programme.desc: In defiance of the Taliban's ban on music, a group of young musicians from Afghanistan risked it all to keep their country's music alive; through heartache and longing, they are taking their message to the world stage as an orchestra in exile.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/86: The Astros scored three runs in the 1st inning and took the lead deep into the 9th, until the Mets retaliated with three runs to send the game into extras. Fast forward to the top of the 16th when Ray Knights hit a go-ahead knock and the rest is history!

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ed Kranepool hits a home run as the Mets shut out the Orioles 5-0 to win Game 3.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series Film from 1980 highlights the Phillies capturing their first win in their 98-year span.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1981 matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees. New York took a 2-0 series lead, but Los Angeles battled back behind strong pitching and a deep lineup to secure the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1986 matchup between the Mets and the Red Sox. A famous error in the 10th inning of Game 6 from Boston's Bill Buckner helped New York rally from a 3-2 series deficit and take home the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Energized by an unthinkable pinch-hit walk-off homer from Kirk Gibson, the Los Angeles Dodgers rally to upset the Oakland Athletics in five games to win the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On April 3, 2018 in his first-ever at-bat at Angel Stadium, Japanese phenom Shohei Ohtani crushes a three-run home run, earning himself a curtain call from the Los Angeles crowd.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On the day of Thurman Munson's funeral, eulogist Bobby Murcer leads the Yankees to a walk-off win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Just 10 days after the tragic September 11 attacks, Mike Piazza lifts a dramatic go-ahead home run in the 8th inning to lift the Mets and the city of New York in the first baseball game played in the city after the tragedy.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On September 26, 2016, the Marlins overcame the tragic loss of pitcher Jos Fernndez to secure an emotional victory, rallying together to honor his memory and celebrate his life amidst profound grief and sorrow.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Roy Halladay outpitches Mark Buehrle in a duel on the mound in the Blue Jays' 2-0 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Tony Prez leads the Reds to clinch World Series over Boston

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki plays in his final Major League game, announcing his retirement after the Mariners conclude a two-game series with the Athletics at the Tokyo Dome in Japan.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Hypercars are still insane, but the idea of a supercar doesn't mean what it used to; a supercar is quiet, has room for family and friends, and delivers spine-crunching acceleration, plus exceptional range and even a luxurious driving experience.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Exploring whether BMW maintains the title of undisputed fast sedan king.

The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu'. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to London's Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This year's challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queen's historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Central chefs Aktar Islam and Daniel Clifford and newcomer Paul Foster kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be pork neck with ribwort plantain and pork scratchings, veal tartare with caramelised sweetbread and burnt onions or breast of squab with confit leg and chilli and sweetcorn shoots?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final chance for chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster to impress Glynn Purnell as they make their desserts - whipped sea buckthorn with meringue and crispy rice, raspberry and tarragon roulade with cookie dough and tarragon oil, and dark chocolate with raspberry jelly and raspberry sorbet. Plus, paralympian Daniel Greaves offers his advice to one chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Central region. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In this battle of the North East chefs, returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin prepare their respective starters. programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan kick things off with their starters. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan present their respective fish courses. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan are challenged to cook their mains and Marcus Wareing judges the dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs compete for the chance to cook at a glittering Olympic banquet. The North West finalists go head-to-head as they prepare a lavish meal for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from the London and South East region. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Wales chefs: returning contenders Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry. All are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chases whitetail deer at our home camp, Kudzu Bluff, on the edge of the MS Delta.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Hunting the late season is just as exciting as hunting during the rut. As a hunter you have the opportunity to better understand a whitetails needs now that winter has come. In this episode Mark Kayser attempts to fill his Iowa buck tag in December.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: John heads back to Kentucky once again!! After moving away in 2016, John hasnt connected on a KY buck since! If it could go wrong, it went wrong! But, optimism is high this year on a new piece of property his buddy from high school just bought! Short window to get this hunt in before the western swing kicks in too! Can he get it done and break the bad luck?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90s, Arden doesnt let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.desc: Hunting means many different things to those of us who do it. Its a way to strengthen relationships, gain deeper connections to the land, provide food for our families and increase our appreciation for elk and other wildlife.

programme.desc: Cliff Lake has some amazing fishing. Targeting PreSpawn Smallmouth with cranks can produce some of the biggest fish of the year!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Dont miss the epic conclusion to Marks expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.desc: Follow Ali and Rush on a typical day when they are not fishing together on their respective coasts

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chases whitetail deer at our home camp, Kudzu Bluff, on the edge of the MS Delta.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Hunting the late season is just as exciting as hunting during the rut. As a hunter you have the opportunity to better understand a whitetails needs now that winter has come. In this episode Mark Kayser attempts to fill his Iowa buck tag in December.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: John heads back to Kentucky once again!! After moving away in 2016, John hasnt connected on a KY buck since! If it could go wrong, it went wrong! But, optimism is high this year on a new piece of property his buddy from high school just bought! Short window to get this hunt in before the western swing kicks in too! Can he get it done and break the bad luck?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90s, Arden doesnt let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Dont miss the epic conclusion to Marks expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: Fire Down Below

programme.title: She Played With Fire

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail bosss business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a well-educated but eccentric intern starts working at the Jeffersonian, Brennan tries to be more open-minded about scientific questions.

programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a young man whose remains were found at a hazardous waste disposal facility; Cam and Arastoo struggle to keep their relationship secret; Brennan and Booth try to decide where to take their vacation.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddingtons thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure theyre never dethroned

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Jon Bon Jovi: Frontman
programme.desc: For almost 40 years Jon Bon Jovi has fronted one of the world's biggest rock bands, Bon Jovi. With hits like "Livin' On A Prayer" and "Bad Medicine," their album sales topped 130 million. Jon Bon Jovi is equally successful as a solo artist and actor.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: Five working-class boys from England leave their factory town in search of fame and fortune.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: Formed in the late 1970s and racking up more than a 100 million album sales, British band Iron Maiden has been heavy metal's undisputed king for nearly 40 years.

programme.title: Twisted Sister: Breaking The Band
programme.desc: In 1984, Twisted Sister was one of the biggest heavy metal bands on the planet. After a decade battling to the top, this Long Island bar band became legendary on MTV, but the band's demise was spectacular.

programme.title: Whitesnake: Story of Their Songs
programme.desc: Delving into the six songs that helped British blues rockers Whitesnake become global rock icons, from their early origins in England though to their '80s U.S. chart-topping smash hit.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: ZZ Top struggles to gain national recognition despite massive success in the South.

programme.title: Van Halen: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: At the height of their success, Van Halen is one of the biggest rock bands in the world, infamous for their excess and raucous live performances.

programme.title: Metallica: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: With a combined fortune of $900 million and being a band for four decades, Metallica is one of the biggest selling heavy metal bands in history.

programme.title: Motley Crue's Vince Neil: My Story
programme.desc: Motley Crue lead singer Vince Neil gives insight into his life, telling the story of his road to stardom and the many bumps in the road that accompanied it.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A storm is growing as Mike and Frank are determined to retrieve an iconic American sports car that's so rare they've never even heard of it.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys are in the South and running low on cash. They're desperate for a good pick when they happen upon a massive old junkyard and closed-down family flea market.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Flying solo in Northern Iowa, Mike comes across the "Goat Man" and combs through his amazing, hidden-away property of junk-filled fields and buses. An Illinois couple's home proves to be a collector's paradise.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank comb through a master collector's untouched outbuildings in North Carolina.

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: As the guys are winding down their trip through the South, Danielle finds them the mother lode of rare motorbike parts in an old warehouse packed with new vintage Harley stock.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While picking their way through the South, the guys meet up with John, a Mississippi motorcycle collector who has plenty of cool stuff, but his prices are through the roof.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While hunting for collectables in Central Iowa, Mike and Frank meet 88-year-old WWII veteran Leland and buy the Japanese sword he brought back from the war.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A logging legend bails Gabe out of trouble; Shelby and an old friend use brute force to pull two logs; the Dreadknots bring in a new diver; the Chapman team looks to catch a log poacher.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Oakes Logging crashes onto the Rygaard families site; Shelby and Mike use redneck ingenuity to pull a huge and rare heart-pine log; the Papac team makes reckless Joe the new yarder operator; the Chapman team gets revenge on a suspected log poacher.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes diving in gator infested waters; Rygaard and Oakes square off on a way road; the Dreadknots go their separate ways; fire breaks out on the mountain.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby's wild ride could end his season early; Rygaard and Oakes compete in a no-holds barred turf war; an accident sidelines one of the Papac crew; Logzilla continues to derail Kraken.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on the hunt for the thief who stole his boat; Rygaard refuses to allow Oakes to pass through their landing; Clint's boat nearly goes up in smoke; Swilley pulls up a prize from the bottom of the lake.

programme.title: The Legend of Shelby the Swamp Man
programme.desc: The Swampman gives back as Shelby prepares to deliver goodies to his favorite people.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Bo Pete Jeffrey claims no memory of the crime he's convicted for, the brutal beating and murder of his wife; four years into his life sentence, Jeffrey tells a different story that opens a new window into the mind of this convicted murderer.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Murdaugh Family Murders
programme.desc: Once prominent South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh's life begins to unravel after the murders of his wife, Maggie, and youngest son Paul as an investigation uncovers years of drug abuse and theft of millions of dollars.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Doomsday Cult Mom
programme.desc: When Lori Vallow's children go missing, she moves to Hawaii and marries cult leader Chad Daybell, leaving behind a path of destruction and several dead bodies in her wake.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Christmas Parade Rampage
programme.desc: The annual Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wis., is struck by tragedy when Darrel Brooks drives his SUV through the parade route; the tragedy turns into a spectacle when Brooks decides to represent himself at trial.

programme.title: Victim To Verdict - Johnny Depp V Amber Heard
programme.desc: Hollywood star Johnny Depp's career suffers after his ex-wife Amber Heard wrote an op-ed claiming to be a victim of sexual violence; what follows is a civil trial that captures the attention of the public.

programme.title: Victim To Verdict: The Killing of Ahmad Arbery
programme.desc: Ahmad Arbery was out jogging when three white men assumed he was a burglar, chased him down and shot him multiple times. Cellphone video captured by Arbery's assailants proved to the jury that these men were not the heroes they claimed to be.

programme.title: Victim To Verdict - Chaos In Kenosha
programme.desc: Kyle Rittenhouse shoots and kills two people and aims a third during a Black Lives Matter protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin; the 17-year-old, armed with an AR-15, claims he acted in self-defense because he feared for his life.

programme.title: Victim To Verdict - A Clown At The Door
programme.desc: A clown carrying balloons and a basket of flowers shoots and kills Marlene Warren when she opens her front door in 1990; even though police suspected Warren's ex-husband and his then-girlfriend, it would take decades to make an arrest.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: The Snake Farm Murder
programme.desc: In 2017, a woman dials 911 to report her husband is dead on the floor of his snake breeding facility; Lynlee Renick claims she has no idea who shot and killed him; after four years of twists, turns and secrets revealed, Lynlee Renick goes to trial.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: : The Prosecution Of Alec Baldwin
programme.desc: A look at the conclusion of actor Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial after cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot and killed on the set of Western film "Rust."

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Both choppers are called to a head-on road smash in the Yorkshire Dales thats left two pensioners trapped in their wrecked car. Ex Royal Marine pilot Harry swoops on a street in Castleford to drop his medics next to an unconscious cyclist feared to have a brain injury. Paramedics Sammy and Ady find themselves dealing with a difficult patient who insists he wants to climb back on his badly damaged motorbike thanks to bizarre effects of a head injury sustained in the accident. Flying doctor Jez is confronted by a baffling whodunnit after a man is accidentally shot at a firing range. A jockey thrown by his galloping horse amazes the team with his toughness as he undergoes treatment on a broken bone without even flinching. Meanwhile, a crash outside one of Yorkshires most famous stately homes leaves a man with a chronic medical condition trapped in his upturned car. On the moors, paramedics Pete and Lee rescue an off road biker injured when his motorcycle toppled off a rock.
